brief_description: Under this scheme, fish farmers who are already engaged in fish farming are provided a 50% subsidy on the total cost of fish inputs such as fish feed, medicines, and other essential materials required for fish farming.
detailed_description: The scheme &quot;State Fisheries Input Scheme&quot; was launched by the Department of Fisheries, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to fish farmers in the form of input subsidies to enhance productivity and sustainability in fish farming. Under this scheme, fish farmers who are already engaged in fish farming are provided a 50% subsidy on fish feed, medicines, and essential input materials such as hand nets, hapa, nets, mini kits, etc.
benefits: Subsidy on the market value of fish feed, medicines, hatchnets, hapas, nets, and minikits.
Fish Feed Subsidy Allocation Based on Pond Size:
1 quintal feed for 100 sq. meter pond. 6 quintals feed for 500 to 2,000 sq. meter pond. 7 quintals feed for R.A.S./Bio floc units. 10 quintals feed for Trout farming units.
50% subsidy on market cost of handnet, hapa, net, and minikit. Limited to 1 unit per item per fish farmer.
eligibility_criteria: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. The applicant should be currently engaged in fish farming. The applicant should belong to any caste categories including general, scheduled caste, scheduled tribe, other backward classes, women, etc. The applicant should own or operate a pond or aquaculture unit (Biofloc, RRS, Trout farm, etc.) within the state.

steps: Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) in the office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge at the district level and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents in the office of the Assistant Director of Fisheries/District Fisheries In-charge.
Step 1: The fisheries inspector or field officer conducts a survey to verify the pond and prepares a detailed proposal in consultation with the beneficiary.
Step 2: The district officer reviews and approves the proposal.
Step 3: Post approval, the beneficiary procures input materials (fish feed, medicines, equipment) from the open market.
Step 4: Submit original purchase bills to the field staff.
Step 5: Bills are verified by field personnel, and 50% of the cost is processed for payment.
Step 6: The approved subsidy amount is credited directly to the farmer's bank account.

Registration Process: Step 1: Visit to e-Services Apuni Sarkar ( https://eservices.uk.gov.in ) and click "Sign Up" on the Citizen Login page. Step 2: Fill in the registration form with your name, email, mobile number, etc., and click Submit. Step 3: You will receive your User ID and password via SMS on your registered mobile number. Application Process: Step 1: Navigate to the Citizen Login page and enter your User ID (email or mobile) and password, complete the captcha, then click Sign In. Step 2: Once logged in, your dashboard appears. Click "Apply for New Application" or similar to begin. Step 3: Choose the Fisheries department, from the list, select the specific scheme you wish to apply for. Step 4: The portal will list mandatory documents required and upload mandatory documents, after uploading, click Submit to proceed. Step 5: Enter all required details in the form (personal, land, bank, etc.). Use Save to save progress, preview to review, or Delete Draft to reset. Step 6: Once all fields are accurately filled, click Submit. You will receive an Application ID receipt, which you can download. Track Application and Approval Step 1: The application goes to the concerned department for review. Step 2: You can track your application status on the portal using your Application ID.  User Manual

documents_required: Applicant Photo Aadhaar Card Land Ownership Document Permanent Residence Certificate Caste Certificate (If applicable, for SC/ST/OBC categories) Bank Account Details/Copy of Front Page of Bank Passbook Mobile Number Details of Pond Related Documents Photo of site/pond Original Bills/Invoices of procured items (Feed, Medicines, Hand nets, etc.) Copy Of Khasra / Khatoni
